00024 #include <gro.hpp>

00026 
00027 
00028 namespace loos {
00029   
00030   void Gromacs::read(std::istream& ifs) {
00031     std::string buf;
00032 
00033     getline(ifs, title_);
00034 
00035     // Get the # of atoms;;;
00036     getline(ifs, buf);
00037     int natoms = parseStringAs<int>(buf);
00038     while (natoms-- > 0) {
00039       getline(ifs, buf);
00040       
00041       int resid = parseStringAs<int>(buf, 0, 5);
00042       std::string resname = parseStringAs<std::string>(buf, 5, 5);
00043       std::string name = parseStringAs<std::string>(buf, 10, 5);
00044       int atomid = parseStringAs<int>(buf, 15, 5);
00045       float x = parseStringAs<float>(buf, 20, 8) * 10.0;
00046       float y = parseStringAs<float>(buf, 28, 8) * 10.0;
00047       float z = parseStringAs<float>(buf, 36, 8) * 10.0;
00048       
00049       // We ignore velocities...
00050       pAtom pa(new Atom);
00051       pa->resid(resid);
00052       pa->id(atomid);
00053       pa->resname(resname);
00054       pa->name(name);
00055       pa->coords(GCoord(x,y,z));
00056 
00057       append(pa);
00058     }
00059 
00060     // Now process box...
00061     getline(ifs, buf);
00062     std::istringstream iss(buf);
00063     GCoord box;
00064     if (!(iss >> box[0] >> box[1] >> box[2]))
00065       throw(std::runtime_error("Cannot parse box '" + buf + "'"));
00066     periodicBox(box);
00067 
00068     // Since the atomic field in .gro files is only 5-chars wide, it can
00069     // overflow.  if there are enough atoms to cause an overflow, manually
00070     // renumber everything...
00071     if (atoms.size() >= 100000)
00072       renumber();
00073   }
00074 
00075 }
